intro: Pothuava fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's pothuava, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited distribution.
